channel.title: 9to5Google
channel.description: Google news, Pixel, Android, Home, Chrome OS, more

item.title: Bandwidth: Xbox Cloud Gaming undergoes performance updates on ChromeOS
item.dc:creator: Andrew Romero
item.description:
There’s no doubt cloud gaming is picking up even more speed as more companies develop ways to improve performance. This week, Xbox Cloud Gaming brought improvements to its PWAs on both ChromeOS and Linux devices.

more…

The post Bandwidth: Xbox Cloud Gaming undergoes performance updates on ChromeOS appeared first on 9to5Google.

item.title: Google’s new Nest Cams still require a full reset if you change Wi-Fi networks – the old ones didn’t
item.dc:creator: Ben Schoon
item.description:
The Nest brand has long been known for providing easy to use hardware and software for building out a smarter home. But that’s a reputation that Google’s takeover and reboot of the brand has somewhat tarnished, and one area that’s easily felt is when comparing feature parity. One example that’s exceptionally frustrating to me is that the new Nest Cam, Doorbell, and other products require a full reset for something as simple as changing Wi-Fi networks.

more…

The post Google’s new Nest Cams still require a full reset if you change Wi-Fi networks – the old ones didn’t appeared first on 9to5Google.

item.title: Android app deals of the day: Superbrothers, ALTER EGO, NABOKI, SPHAZE, and more
item.dc:creator: 9to5Toys
item.description:
Friday’s best Android game and app deals are now ready and waiting down below via Google Play. On the hardware side of things, we are tracking new price drops on Samsung’s Golf Edition Galaxy Watch 5 as well as the Galaxy S22 Ultra and some budget-friendly Pixel 7 Pro cases, but for now it’s all about the apps. Highlight deals include Superbrothers Sword & Sworcery, ALTER EGO COMPLEX, Tropical Resort Story, NABOKI, SPHAZE, and more. Head below for a complete look at today’s best Android app deals.

item.title: Do you like Wear OS 3’s UI and navigation on the Pixel Watch?
item.dc:creator: Abner Li
item.description:
The Pixel Watch was most people’s first introduction — $1,300 wearable aside —  to “stock” Wear OS 3, with the Fossil Gen 6 update rolling out shortly after. Now that more people have had time to use it, what do you think about Wear OS 3’s core UI and navigation?

item.dc:creator: Andrew Romero
item.description:

item.title: Deals: Samsung’s Golf Edition Galaxy Watch 5 $299, Sony LinkBuds/S $128, and more
item.dc:creator: Justin Kahn
item.description:
It’s time head in to the weekend with all of Friday’s most notable price drops on Android-friendly gear starting with the Samsung’s Golf Edition Galaxy Watch 5. While the standard edition models are starting from $250 now, the special golf edition that might make for a sweet gift this year has now returned to the Amazon low. That deal joins the best price yet on Sony’s LinkBuds/S and other ANC headphones as well as a particular notable offer on an open-box unlocked Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. Hit the jump for all that and more in the latest 9to5Toys Lunch Break.

item.dc:creator: Andrew Romero
item.description:
It seems a little limiting to only play your favorite Android games on your phone or tablet. Recently, Google opened the way for users to play those Android games on their PC. This guide will take you through getting started so you can start downloading Android games on to your computer.

item.dc:creator: Kyle Bradshaw
item.description:

Update: Google is bringing its updated photo picker to nearly every Android device, including ones that are quite outdated.

item.title: ‘Quick phrases’ on your Pixel: How to turn them on and use them

item.description:
Google’s Pixel lineup has the goal of making your life just a little bit easier. This is evident with the dozens of smart features that have made their way to the Pixel 7 and Pixel 6 series. One favorite Pixel feature is called “quick phrases.” This guide will take you through exactly what they do.

item.title: Review: Montblanc Summit 3 is an stellar Wear OS 3 watch that’s probably not for you
item.dc:creator: Ben Schoon
item.description:
Wear OS has long been a platform for the many, not just one or two smartwatch models. It provides a ton of choice for customers, and with Wear OS 3, it’s also giving brands an easier path to crafting what their smartwatch experience looks like. The Montblanc Summit 3 is one of the first Wear OS 3 watches, and it’s an excellent entry but one that’s certainly not for most folks.

more…

The post Review: Montblanc Summit 3 is an stellar Wear OS 3 watch that’s probably not for you appeared first on 9to5Google.

item.title: Google rolls out ‘My Ad Center’ to let people customize their advertising [U: Live]
item.dc:creator: Abner Li
item.description:
At I/O 2022 in May, Google announced “My Ad Center” to let you control advertising by topic and brand. It’s now starting to roll out with a rather bold approach that might get people to interact with advertising more by letting them customize it directly. Once live in the coming weeks, My Ad Center will offer an app-like (think: topics and interests in Google News or Discover) level of customization.

more…

The post Google rolls out ‘My Ad Center’ to let people customize their advertising [U: Live] appeared first on 9to5Google.

item.title: Google Voice is one of the first apps adding support for Android’s new image picker
item.dc:creator: Ben Schoon
item.description:
With the release of Android 13, Google debuted a new image picker for Android that’s also available on older versions of the operating system. With a recent update, Google Voice is adding support for that new photo picker.
